positive.review:
Farm Together 2 has absolutely become my go-to game these days. I adored the first one, and the sequel is nothing but a massive improvement in every way. Everything feels so much more smooth, and i especially love the automatic mode. its honestly a game changer, it makes the whole experience so much more relaxing and satisfying.

I cant recommend it enough if you enjoyed the first game, or if youre just craving something wholesome and relaxing. Its perfect for unwinding after a long day, zoning out with some chill music, or farming with friends while talking nonsense. 

I really hope there will be more DLC in the future with cute items and outfits. ðŸŒ·

A very nice oddly addictive chill game that I was able to couch co-op with my wife, there's an interesting side of games you get to explore when you play with someone who doesn't usually play video games and in this case it was the incredible amount of customization you can put into making everything look "pretty" the graphics are playful and even though sometimes you can be waiting for crops to grow you will also somehow find yourself busy with something

Best chill game with friends. One of the best farming game I have played, can enjoy video on second monitor and just plant vegetables or harvest animals. Slightly hating the town mechanic, but after one patch the amount of things you can sell was increased so it is fine now

I've played both Farm Together and Farm Together 2. I think these are relaxing fun games to play solo, with friends, or to let others come and help on the farm. Out of almost 3000 hours between games, I've never stumbled upon a bug personally.  New content is regularly pushed as free updates and then themed DLCs are released with generally the same things like a new flower, crop, tree, building to build and decor. Absolutely enjoy zoning out or redesigning my farm.

fun, relaxing game (if you're not like me and spend hours just trying to get everything centered or symmetrical or efficient).
friendly, helpful community and devs.
frequent updates adding content and changing stuff based on suggestions.
love it. â™¡
later found myself in trouble with organizing these tremendous empty lands! enjoy the way it keeping me busy all the time. its worth it, im ngl.

Playing Farm Together 2 is a delightful experience! Right from the start, the game feels welcoming with its bright, colorful graphics and charming soundtrack. The gameplay is easy to pick up. I cant recommend it enough if you enjoyed the first game, or if youre just craving something wholesome and relaxing. Its perfect for unwinding after a long day, zoning out with some chill music, or farming with friends while talking nonsense.

If you like the first one you will love this one. Yes people say it has similar things and thats fine. They are continuing work on this one and listening to the community for changes and updates. Great game
Fun, relaxing, and eventually lots to do.
Loving the upgrade compared to the first, events are fun too just wish more joined to help with event crops past the first day of the event
Played with my child - encouraging reading and figuring out systems.  He was about it for a few hours before wanting to get back into the Roblox.

I've played for over 60hrs. The pace is really good. you unlock new plants and farm gear very consistently keeping the game engaging and fun. They add a lot of automation to help farm easier for solo play. They all made it very easy to play with others. The only complaint I have is there is no way to share the farm so someone else can be in the farm without the host being logged in. Overall great game and I recommend this to anyone that likes cozy farming games or enjoys them with friends and family.

I loved the first one, so naturally I had to buy the second one. I absolutely love the new mechanics to the new game. It's a great game that sucks you when as you gain more and more room for plots. It has a great mixture of both the old game with some new added features. It's a great cozy game that offers longevity to the game play...I also love all the decorations.
The common-sense gameplay mechanics make this a no-brainer. My wife and I are obsessed!
I love this game! It's chill and fun to play. The community is a little off-putting, but otherwise the game is great.
Nice cozy game to sink tons of hours into unlocking new crops, animals, and decorations.
I think the hours spent, and that I'm still spending in the game speaks for itself.
Great game, no real bugs. Gameplay is relaxing and casual. Outstanding for crossplay/co-op.
perfect game to chill after a hard day of work. just keep building your farm and grind till you fall asleep

Very chill, casual farming game that's fun solo as well as with friends. Game stays fresh with seasonal events, and the developers are very active. If you liked the first Farm Together, you'll love this one even more.

Fantastic little slice of peace and quiet. No pressure to do anything and no race to keep up with other players or a market. Log in, drive through a pond at full speed and plant a tree you will later move to make space for another road.

I donâ€™t usually write reviews, but this game truly deserves one. If youâ€™re looking for something calm and relaxing, this is it. Itâ€™s enjoyable whether you play solo or with friends. Thereâ€™s definitely plenty of grinding if youâ€™re a completionist, but the creativity and possibilities are endless. The developers have done an outstanding job with regular updates and free content, and the in-game events are always a highlight. Cheers!
Simple fun and relaxing what more can you ask from a farming game.

An upgrade in every way over the first game of the series. Especially the edition of the town changes the feel of the game quite a bit.

Absolutely recommend this for relaxed gameplay and endless improvements you can do to your farm.
Fun farm sim game, simple but yet relaxing
This is the game you need to play with your partner from RV there yet... it's the best way to not want to never play with each other again! A lot of fun and very relaxing.

One of the most underrated games I have ever played in my entire life. Perfect to relax and be as creative as you'd like while not having to worry about stress. It's truly an incredible game. So was the first Farm Together. I recommend giving them both a try. Just sit down and let your brain go on auto pilot lol.
A fun grind to expand your farm. Perfect for both afk & active play. I loved the first game and will keep playing FT2 for the foreseeable future :3

Farm Together 2 is unbelievably cozy and addictive. Iâ€™ve put over 334 hours into it and still look forward to logging in every single day. The progression feels satisfying, the visuals are relaxing, and building and organizing your farm is endlessly fun. Whether you want chill solo gameplay or to farm with friends, itâ€™s one of the best relaxing games out there. Highly recommend for anyone who loves creativity, collecting, and calm vibes.
Great game to spend many hours in, good relaxing farm sim.
Best game ever to play, relax and chill!

Farm Together 2 is the perfect cozy escape. It lets you jump into a shared farm, plant crops, decorate your land, and slowly watch everything come together at your own pace. Thereâ€™s no pressure or stress just super chill, laid back gameplay.
Very relaxing game that is fun to play alone as well as with others.
Cute and adorable game, always puts me in a good mood.

I have been playing this game since launch and even played the first one, I quite love this game and how laid back it is. No matter what I'm feeling I always know that I can hop onto this game and just spend hours working on making my farm look really nice.

It's definitely not farming simulator with all the name brands and big machines, but it will let you emerse yourself in a different way of farming. Very well made and fun to play with friends or just by yourself.
Very good for casual players. Easy to understand, calm and relax to play. Enjoyable experience.

Absolutely fantastic game, especially if you want to sit and relax. No time limits, you can do everything at your own pace. I have recommended this to a LOT of my friends and we all help each other out on the farm! I will never get bored of farming!

Probably my all time favorite relaxing game. It has a nice style and fulfilling gameplay loop. It has the hooks of mobile gaming but no microtransactions. Progress is nice and you can quickly make a beautiful farm.

Stress free farming game that your friends can play with you, you can have a whole range of animals, a pet and several houses if you want them. It has quests to fulfil and time limited events at set times through the year. I loved the first game and this one has even more things added you can do. Highly recommend.
Fun chill game. Definitely an improvement upon the first game
Everything about this game is a step up from the first....That is saying a lot because I LOVED the first Farm Together!
Just sit back and relax and enjoy some farming. Super fun game to watch the hours fly by.
Love FTG1 and love this one, appreciate the frequent updates and content!
Chill, farming game you can sink multiple lifetimes into.
A calm and cozy game better with others!
It is a very simple game that is easy to play in the background while you're listening to an audiobook or watching a show. It improved a lot of quality of life things from the first game.

As far as relaxing games go, this is one of the best in my honest opinion.  Really scratches that itch of terraforming, building and decorating.  I can completely turn my brain off as I play this and listen to something else in the background and that's just to me what makes for a great relaxing game.
Great relaxing farm sim. As a fan of the first one, this one is even better and adds so much more content.
Perfect for sitting back and relaxing. Mindless semi-afk fun.
Just sit back, relax and farm some crops. This game is awesome, although i didnt play it very long, i will come back later just to catch up with the progress.

Farm Together 2 is pure zen farming â€” plant, harvest, and get lost in the flow.
Tractors, terraforming, and a lively little town make the farm feel alive.
Timers keep the pace, but itâ€™s never stressful â€” just relaxing progression.
Content is solid, updates add more fun, and itâ€™s perfect for a chill session.
Huge thanks for the Ukrainian language support â€” it makes the experience even better! 9/10.
Fun overall game, great to play with friends and family

I played the first iteration of this game and have to say that Farm Together 2 is addictive and has all of the quality of life features that the first game wanted.  I'm low key obsessed with this game.
What an incredible improvement from the first game!!!!! Hope we get more NPC townies updates with new gameplay in the town etc but so far it been so wonderful and hope more people play this gem!!!!!

It's the best farming game to play co-op/split screen!
Beautiful graphics, easy to learn, has lots of things that you can do, lots of customization.

Much better than 1st one :) 
I was sceptical if it's worth buying it but glad I did!
Terrain shaping drone, auto-tractor and lot of quality-of-life features.

Fun light game to play, especially good with family members who may not be into video games. Lots of customization options and reasonable depth of challenges for a casual game like this. My wife loves it and plays on Switch and I play on PC, crossplay has been relatively easy between consoles unless there is an update mistake which can take some days to fix before crossplay between those two consoles are fixed.
I enjoy this game due to the beautiful graphics, ease in decorations and it allows to use your creativity, endless fun! I can play it in multiple platforms and with friends. I highly recommend.

Love this game! It is fun to just pass time. The community tends to be friendly. I would definitely recommend it to anyone who likes a game that you can pick up and put down or even put a lot of time into!
Lots of crops, animals, trees and flowers to decorate or massively accumulate. Great events and updates!
fun and cozy and fun with friends

Cute, enjoyable game........................when you don't look at the cost of everything and your harvest.  
ONE apple tree gives ONE apple per season.  Some trees don't produce every season, so you'll get ONE APPLE ONCE PER YEAR!  The regular apple tree will give you 4 apples per year. One horse eats 4 apples per day. Think about that. It takes 4 seasons to get enough apples to feed a horse each day!  So, you do the math. That horse will cost you 22,000 to 84,000 depending upon which horse you buy.   That apple tree will cost you 100 to 13,650 depending upon the type tree.  So, you'll have to plant 4 trees costing 400 to get 4 apples per year to feed one horse per day.  But wait, a season is only (?) 17 minutes long.  So you have to wait 68 minutes to get enough apples to feed one horse per day.  The horses only produce every TWO days though.  You'll get one horseshoe (yes, this game has horses producing horseshoes instead of you producing horseshoes for the horses to wear) and 13,354 - 24,642 money.  You'll be doing a lot of math in this game, so you'll know how much of what crop to plant to feed the amount of animals you have.

Then there's the farmhands. With 25 farmhands, YOU will still be harvesting 75% of the map.  IRL, if my farmhands did only 25% of the work, I'd fire them all!  LOL!  IF you don't pay them, they won't work, too, but who would?  Imagine, 25 people only harvesting 1/4 of the crops while you harvest 3/4!  What owner does that?  They aren't worth having, are they?  They cost one "medal" per hour.  For 90 apples and 100 yellow cherry tomatoes you can get 9 medals. Or, for 260 hyacinth beans and 40 coral trout you can get 12 medals. Then, for 90 white sardines you can get 8 medals. Wait, you can get 20 medals for 70 pacific sardinella and 80 girolando cows. That is, harvesting all those items.

There's more: go to town and see what happens to you and your finances. Upgrading those tiny little shops in that tiny town will cost you millions!  If you want to build a house, it will cost you more than money. You'll have to pay some of it with your crops.  

Sorry, but I just can't get past one tree or plant producing one item!  You can see 4 apples falling off the tree when harvested, but you only get ONE apple per tree.  What kind of nonsense is this?  Why do the developers torment the player so badly?  Here's what real life pros say, You can expect an apple tree to yield between 50 to 300 apples per year once it reaches maturity.  Well-maintained mature trees can produce 400 to 800 apples annually under ideal conditions.  But, we only get ONE!  Then, they drive you crazy with seasonal production. You have to figure out which plant/tree/animal produces in which season.  Some produce every fall. Some produce every fall and spring. Some produce summer and winter. Some produce every season, but not many. 

Just look at the cost of plants and animals!   One more thing, the devs punish you if you give the fish a good sized pond. To shout animal cruelty, I made 90% of the map FISH, lol.  I never could understand  how people keep a poor little bird in a tiny cage or a poor fish in a tiny bowl. Out in the wild, the birds have the whole sky to fly in and the fish have steams, rivers, lakes and oceans to swim in. 

Once you have  your crops/trees planted, you'll "enjoy" long periods of time merely watching the little Jeep (tractor) drive ever so slowly across the map harvesting. Sometimes, I'm so bored that I fall alseep, lol.  I like the building of the farm; the rest is very boring.
So much to do! I love playing this game with my boyfriend, we lose track of time lol
It's super cute and they've made a lot of improvements from the first one.

Tony and Arthur are truly the backbone of our community. Their pasture produce is on another level â€” fresh, flavorful, and consistently high-quality. You can genuinely taste the care and hard work they put into everything they grow.

Everyone in town knows about Tony and Arthurâ€™s pastures because their products are simply unmatched. Whether itâ€™s fruits, vegetables, or anything else they bring in from the farm, people trust it and choose it over anything from the store. Their produce has become a staple in homes all across the area.

Tony and Arthur donâ€™t just run a pasture â€” they deliver quality that brings the whole community together. I couldnâ€™t recommend them more!
Always fun for in between. Casual Play, but also a time sink because you can get lost in all the tasks and decorating :)
Ich hab den VorgÃ¤nger gespielt und fande diesen schon super. Teil 2 hat nochmal vieles verbessert, was beim ersten noch gefehlt hat. Kann das Spiel empfehlen.
Super chill and fun. More options than Farm Together 1.
Farm Together 2 is everything that made FT1 so good and enhances it. I love this game!
Great chill game, not a race but a marathon.

Iâ€™ve been playing for a long time and really enjoy it, whether Iâ€™m with friends or on my own. So far, I like it more than Farm Together 1 because all the automation features really help save my hands and wrists.
Better with friends ðŸ§¡  love playing this game it's very relaxing for me
Great game. I wish there was a way to make dedicated servers though
Great Game Especially with friends in multiplayer

I already liked the first one a lot and hoped for a sequel, so I knew what I was getting.
Farm Together 2 is an evolution in every aspect. 

I had lots of fun! Just wish the farm was bigger :p
Takes what was great about the first game and improved on it

It's a relatively simple farming game, it reminds me of Farmville a lot. It is kind of one of those games that you can pick up and put down eaisily. It's not an overly easy game especially since it runs on real time hours but its not frustrating. Definatly a low stress good vibes game.
Cute fun cozy game. Easy to sit back on and relax with.
Approx 1200 hours across PC and Xbox, this game has something that just keeps making me want to play.  Great solo or with friends! Improves on everything from the first game.

I threw hundreds of hours into the first one on one platform or another and this one will be no different. Especially with the additional town features, the terrain tools, the bigger map and the quality of life improvements. This game is ideal for relaxing and yet there's always something to be tinkering with so you aren't just waiting for things to grow. Brilliant.
Avslappnande, bra spel om man inte har sÃ¥ mycket tid fÃ¶r gaming
If you loved Farmville, you will absolutely go head over heels for this game. There's so much to do, hours can go by without you realizing it. Highly Recommend!
Relaxing game. Good to play with friends.
I'm playing split screen with my children. Works well, everybody having fun.
Fun little game so far, devs very active.
Definitely can get lost for hours on this game! Love love love it!
I'm really not sure. It looks fun but I rather farm alone.
Good but not as good as the first game
Love just chilling with my friends, playing this game:)
Great chill game, easy to lose hours to.
Fun little game for some spare time.
If you like Farm Together then you like this, not much else to say really
One of my favorite games to just chill and play!
I get to be cute and also have a puppy with me. What's not to love?
Ultimate time waster where you have always something to do.
I have been enjoying playing this game, it is one that me and my friend will be playing a lot.
Relaxing game when you have a few hours to spare.
Really fun to play with Friends.
Lovely cool game for chilling

negative.review:
The developers claim that they would like to have feedback on their game and features.
However, the developers say that it is not actual feedback if they don't like the feedback.

It's a bit expensive for what it is. It's an alright game, but not really challanging in any way. Tbh I don't have a massive amount of hours in the game, but it gets boring real quick, had to buy it twice so i can play with my partner, if I had had to buy it once and both can play it would have been a better taste in my mouth.
Really really bad balance, better buy the first one

I thought sequels were meant to be better than the previous one in games? If the first farm together had the auto tractor it would hands down be better than the second. The lack of decoration is insane. The fact that even what I call the default furniture in the house, is drab and very limited. The ability to change colors would be a factor thatâ€™s better than the original, but itâ€™s still not good. I believe I got the original and all of the theme packs on sale and it was as much or cheaper than the 2nd.

If you never experience the auto tractor Iâ€™d recommend the first one hands down over the second. I like the first one. I still play the second, but I canâ€™t recommend it. Maybe after more updates, but not currently. I was extremely disappointed.

Farm Together 2 is a huge disappointment. Instead of improving on the first game, it feels like a downgrade in almost every way. The progression is painfully slow, the grind is worse than ever, and many of the fun, simple features from the first game are either gone or locked behind frustrating mechanics.

The game feels empty, repetitive, and lacks the charm that made Farm Together 1 so addictive. It honestly feels like a cash grab rather than a true sequel.

If you loved the first game, do yourself a favor and stick with it â€” Farm Together 2 is not worth your time or money in its current state.
There's just not enough to do. It may be an early game issue, but I'm not willing to sit around for crops to grow bored out of my mind thinking it may get better later.

The developers claim that they would like to have feedback on their game and features.
However, the developers say that it is not actual feedback if they don't like the feedback.

I'm not really sure who it's for, but certainly not for me.

It is, perhaps, the most shallow game of its genre that I have ever played. It would make sense if it was for very young children, who wouldn't be bored by it having neither a story nor much real sandbox customization, but its wall-of-text explanations on how to use the most obvious features clearly rules that theory out. Just off the top of my head, I can think of at least a dozen other games that would be a better choice than Farm Together 2, and most of them are cheaper.

However, my 18 month old does enjoy driving the tractor around for about 10 minutes at a time. So there's that, I guess. But overall, it's a big thumbs down from me.

It's a bit expensive for what it is. It's an alright game, but not really challanging in any way. Tbh I don't have a massive amount of hours in the game, but it gets boring real quick, had to buy it twice so i can play with my partner, if I had had to buy it once and both can play it would have been a better taste in my mouth.
Really really bad balance, better buy the first one

It's a bit expensive for what it is. It's an alright game, but not really challanging in any way. Tbh I don't have a massive amount of hours in the game, but it gets boring real quick, had to buy it twice so i can play with my partner, if I had had to buy it once and both can play it would have been a better taste in my mouth.
Really really bad balance, better buy the first one

I thought sequels were meant to be better than the previous one in games? If the first farm together had the auto tractor it would hands down be better than the second. The lack of decoration is insane. The fact that even what I call the default furniture in the house, is drab and very limited. The ability to change colors would be a factor thatâ€™s better than the original, but itâ€™s still not good. I believe I got the original and all of the theme packs on sale and it was as much or cheaper than the 2nd.

If you never experience the auto tractor Iâ€™d recommend the first one hands down over the second. I like the first one. I still play the second, but I canâ€™t recommend it. Maybe after more updates, but not currently. I was extremely disappointed.

Farm Together 2 is a huge disappointment. Instead of improving on the first game, it feels like a downgrade in almost every way. The progression is painfully slow, the grind is worse than ever, and many of the fun, simple features from the first game are either gone or locked behind frustrating mechanics.

The game feels empty, repetitive, and lacks the charm that made Farm Together 1 so addictive. It honestly feels like a cash grab rather than a true sequel.

If you loved the first game, do yourself a favor and stick with it â€” Farm Together 2 is not worth your time or money in its current state.
There's just not enough to do. It may be an early game issue, but I'm not willing to sit around for crops to grow bored out of my mind thinking it may get better later.

The developers claim that they would like to have feedback on their game and features.
However, the developers say that it is not actual feedback if they don't like the feedback.

I'm not really sure who it's for, but certainly not for me.

It is, perhaps, the most shallow game of its genre that I have ever played. It would make sense if it was for very young children, who wouldn't be bored by it having neither a story nor much real sandbox customization, but its wall-of-text explanations on how to use the most obvious features clearly rules that theory out. Just off the top of my head, I can think of at least a dozen other games that would be a better choice than Farm Together 2, and most of them are cheaper.

However, my 18 month old does enjoy driving the tractor around for about 10 minutes at a time. So there's that, I guess. But overall, it's a big thumbs down from me.

It's a bit expensive for what it is. It's an alright game, but not really challanging in any way. Tbh I don't have a massive amount of hours in the game, but it gets boring real quick, had to buy it twice so i can play with my partner, if I had had to buy it once and both can play it would have been a better taste in my mouth.
Really really bad balance, better buy the first one
